title: From Evergreen's Airplane Collection
content: [](http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/1134/545/1600/mig1.jpg)A MiGPhoto by K. UrnerPer our tour guide: the MiG's guns pointed upward 15 degrees for some reason, so the way to avoid being shot at was to fly very close to the ground. If you were shot at anyway, because the MiG was chasing you upside down, the pilot was probably Russian.
author: Kirby Urner
